intro: Couratari atrovinosa, commonly known as black couratari, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark, leathery leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is often found in lowland rainforests. The botanical features of Couratari atrovinosa make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
